A pleasant conceited comedie, called, A knacke to know an honest man As it hath beene sundrie times plaied about the citie of London. Knack to know an honest man.
[62] p.
Printed [by T. Scarlet] for Cuthbert Burby, and are to be solde at his shop by the Royall Exchange, London : 1596.
Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-H⁴ (-A1). Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
